alert.note: Alert for Coconino; Navajo (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 12 at 6:22PM MST until August 12 at 9:15PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Coconino County in north central Arizona... Navajo County in north central Arizona... * Until 915 PM MST. * At 620 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain in multiple areas including just east of Tuba City, along State Route 98 through Kaibito, the Navajo Creek basin, and West Canyon Creek. Between 0.75 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen in some areas. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Inscription House Landing Strip, Cow Springs, Tonalea, Navajo National Monument, Antelope Creek Basin, Glen Canyon National Recreation Area, Kaibito, Lake Powell, Hopi Reservation and Navajo Reservation. This includes the following highways... Highway 160 between mile markers 325 and 354. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... West Canyon Creek, Narrow Wash, Tsegi Canyon, Chaiyahi Creek, Navajo Creek, Square Butte Wash, Moenkopi Wash, Starting Water Wash, Nokai Creek, Kaibito Creek, Shonto Wash, Porcupine Wash, Begashibito Wash, Last End Wash and Last Chance Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Normally dry washes, slot canyons and creeks can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
